overview:
Shadechester FC will be the happiest team and manager this week as they scored an impressive 84pts and moved up 2 places to 2nd place. They displaced Norfolk N Chance and Yorkshire Lass UTD who have moved down into 3rd and 4th respectively.

Try Hard FC continue to maintain their lead, however they will be disappointed with their fairly average score of 64pts this week, giving some hope to the chasing pack.

The teams that performed well this week were the ones who gave the captains armband to Erling Haaland - scoring 2 goals against Bournemouth and picking up 13pts, or 26pts as captain. Some teams didn't fancy Haaland to do well against high-flying Bournemouth after blanking last week and opted for Newcastle's Woltemade and Bruno G who were playing a poor West Ham side - the risk didn't pay off however as the Toon went down 3-1 to the Hammers and Woltemade was subbed at half time.

It will be interesting to see what captain choices teams make next week with Man City facing their title rivals, Liverpool.
totwDescription:
Shadechester FC are the highest scoring team of GW10, with 84pts. It is their first TOTW award of the season which is surprising considering they've been in and around the top 3 since the start. Goals for all 3 strikers and assists for Gabriel and Caicedo helped Jade's team move up to 2nd place. Well done Jade üëèüèª

Small shout out to What's for pud.. who we're 16th at the start of GW10 and scored 83pts this week - more weeks like that and you'll soon be in the top 10.
sackedDescription: I don't know are the lowest scoring team for a second consecutive week, scoring a disappointing 42pts. With captain Thierno Barry blanking yet again and very little in the way of goals or clean sheets coming from the other players, it was a tough week for Charlie's team. Might be time to dig out that Wildcard üÉè

otherUpdates.title: üëåüèª Player of the Week
otherUpdates.content: Diego G√≥mez Amarilla (BHA üîµ‚ö™ - ¬£4.9m) is this week's POTW with 16pts after netting 2 goals and a clean sheet against Leeds United. He is selected by 0.1% of all teams which I believe is the lowest TSB% of a POTW this season. It demonstrates just how difficult this game is and how unpredictable this season has been so far.

otherUpdates.content: The deadline for locking in teams, transfers and chips for GW11 is Saturday 8th November at 11am.
